metadata.title: CVE-2015-1303 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
bindings/core/v8/V8DOMWrapper.h in Blink, as used in Google Chrome before45.0.2454.101, does not perform a rethrow action to propagate informationabout a cross-context exception, which allows remote attackers to bypassthe Same Origin Policy via a crafted HTML document containing an IFRAMEelement.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1303` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 45.0.2454.101-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1099
chromium-browser-l10n - 45.0.2454.101-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1099
chromium-chromedriver - 45.0.2454.101-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1099
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 45.0.2454.101-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1099
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 45.0.2454.101-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1099
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.9.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.9.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.9.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.9.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.9.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.9.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.9.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '45.0.2454.101-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1099').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
